medical_history.chief_complaint: Vitamin D 1/H9251-hydroxylase deficiency characterized by clinical features of rickets.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms presented within the first 22 months of life, including conditions such as bowed legs, seizures, hypocalcemia, and various degrees of rickets. Specific examples include hypocalcemic seizures at 5 months of age and complications such as fractures and severe malnutrition leading to multiple organ failure.
medical_history.family_history: The parents and siblings of the patients were asymptomatic. Specific mutations were found in some family members, indicating potential hereditary patterns.
